alert.note: Alert for McKenzie; Williams (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 10:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Missouri River near Williston affecting Williams and McKenzie Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missouri River near Williston. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Ditches in the vicinity of the river will fill and wildlife management lands along the south banks will begin to flood. At 22.0 feet, Low-lying farmland and access roads to oil well sites near Trenton are flooded. City of Williston does not flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday /7:00 AM MDT Wednesday/ the stage was 21.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday morning and continue rising to a crest of 22.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.5 feet on 05/29/1997. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
